thread.title: Ridiculous team goal and finish from Nigerian Premier League could be early contender for 2017 Puskas Award
thread.title_full: Ridiculous team goal and finish from Nigerian Premier League could be early contender for 2017 Puskas Award

author: Thomas Bristow
title: Ridiculous team goal and finish from Nigerian Premier League could be early contender for 2017 Puskas Award
text:
Ridiculous team goal and finish from Nigerian Premier League could be early contender for 2017 Puskas Award Mountains of Fire's Sikiru Olatunbosun produced a marvellous volley to finish off a well-rounded team move Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Sikiru Olatunbosun 's stunning volley for MFM FC Share this video Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Just one month after it was announced Mohd Faiz Subri had won the 2016 Puskas Award with his superb swerving free-kick, we have a contender for the 2017 award. 
On Friday, Mountains of Fire (fourth) took on Enugu Rangers (18th) in the Nigerian Premier League. After 30 minutes, MNF's Sikiru Olatunbosun had all his club's coaches and substitutes running down the touchline towards him. 
After two neat lobbed passes, the MFM player collects the ball on the edge of the box, flicks the ball over an opposing player's head and smashes it first time on the volley. (Photo: @XANTAPLUS/Twitter) 
The Enugu Rangers keeper can only watch on as the ball sails over his head and into the back of the net. (Photo: @XANTAPLUS/Twitter) 
Predictably, everyone inside MFM's stadium goes berserk with many calling for it to be a Puskas Award contender. 
Can't say we blame them... poll loading Should Sikiru Olatunbosun's strike be a 2017 Puskas Award contender? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
